nodes.bodyText: We should pick a fixed return type for this function. Otherwise, the type will change from version to version (especially, for non-release builds, which tend to have longer version numbers). Let's go with VARCHAR, since we can't predict what the maximum length of the version string will be in advance.
Let’s call the this the server version, as “node” implies it is the version of a specific node (and which node in the cluster would it be?)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,9 @@
+==================
+System Information
+==================
+
+Functions providing information about the system environment.
+
+.. function:: version() -> varchar
+
+    Returns the node version.

nodes.bodyText:
This seems to be the only test and so we do not really know whether the function works or always returns "".
Do we need a product test for this function?
